docs.title: Cities War — Official Wiki
docs.text:
Welcome to the Cities War official game guide. This site contains detailed data, strategy guides, and system mechanics to help you master the game.

  • 🚀 Quick start: Getting Started → Overview
  • 🧭 Find units: Units → Ground Forces / Navy / Air Force
  • 🛠 Development & buildings: Buildings
  • ⚔ Learn combat: Gameplay → Combat System

Tip: Use the search box in the top-right to quickly jump to unit stats or mechanics.

docs.title: Featured
docs.text:
• New: City Durability system introduced (see Changelog).
  • Pro tip: Balance resource income before expanding armies.

docs.title: City Hall
docs.text: City Hall increases city capacity and unlocks higher-tier upgrades.

docs.title: Effects
docs.text:
• Increases maximum population cap.
  • Reduces construction cost for public buildings.

docs.title: Factory
docs.text: Factories produce equipment and allow repairs.

docs.title: Production Notes
docs.text:
• Factory throughput scales with level.
  • Higher-level factories unlock advanced gear.

docs.title: Hospital
docs.text: Hospitals handle wounded troops and speed up recovery.

docs.title: Tips
docs.text: • Build hospitals in frontier cities to reduce troop attrition.

docs.title: Alliances
docs.text:
Alliances are essential for late-game dominance.

  • Coordinate resource transfers (within alliance systems).
  • Assign roles: attackers, defenders, support.
  • Use alliance borders strategically to create chokepoints.

docs.title: Combat System
docs.text: Combat is resolved by comparing attacker and defender effective strengths.

docs.title: Simplified Formula
docs.text: Effective Power = Sum(Unit Attack × Count) × Modifiers

docs.title: Modifiers
docs.text:
• Terrain bonuses
  • City durability (new)
  • Alliance defensive bonuses

docs.title: Example
docs.text: Attacker: 1000 infantry (attack 15) → base 15000 Defender: mixed units + city defenses → compare totals and apply modifiers.

docs.title: Defense Mechanisms
docs.text:
Defense is more than raw numbers.

  • City Durability: Cities have a durability bar that grants percent defense bonuses.
  • Defensive Buildings: Walls, Forts, Garrison bonuses.
  • Alliances: Alliance borders can provide bonus defense multipliers.

docs.title: Traps
docs.text:
Traps are mechanisms to deter reckless attacks.

  • Mines and automatic defenses can damage invading forces.
  • Traps often have cooldowns and maintenance costs.

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
Q: Can I transfer resources between accounts? A: No — account-to-account transfers are not supported.

Q: How does city capture work? A: When attacking, compare total attack vs defense (see Combat System). If attacker overcomes defender, the city falls.

Q: Where are update notes? A: See Changelog in the navigation.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Cities War is a territory-control strategy game where players capture and develop real-world cities. Your goals: gather resources, upgrade infrastructure, build armies, and form alliances.

docs.title: Core Concepts
docs.text:
• Cities: control points that provide resources and strategic value.
  • Resources: Oil, Steel, Rare, Uranium, Food, Gold.
  • Forces: Ground (infantry, tanks), Navy (ships), Air Force (fighters, bombers), Missiles.
  • Buildings: City Hall, Hospital, Factory, etc.

docs.title: Play Loop
docs.text:
1. Capture nearby neutral cities.
  2. Upgrade resource production.
  3. Build and supply armies.
  4. Coordinate with alliance members for large-scale operations.

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
Resources are the backbone of your empire.

Resource Use Oil Fuel for units and production Steel Building and unit construction Rare Advanced units and upgrades Uranium High-tier weapons and missiles Food Troop maintenance Gold Marketplace, conversions, special purchases

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Focus on a steady income rather than spikes.
  • Convert excess resources into Gold when safe.

docs.title: Defense Strategy
docs.text:
A solid defense relies on depth.

  • Layer defenses: city fortifications, allied reinforcements, fallback positions.
  • Keep reserves to plug breaches.

docs.title: Economy
docs.text:
Sustainable growth beats short-term spikes.

  • Diversify resource production.
  • Prioritize stable gold generation for late-game flexibility.

docs.title: Offense Strategy
docs.text:
Good offenses are prepared offensives.

  • Scout before attacking.
  • Ensure logistics: fuel, repair, and routes.
  • Coordinate timing with allies.

docs.title: v1.2 — City Durability (2025-09-14)
docs.text:
• Added City Durability: cities recover durability over time (max 2000).
  • Every 100 durability grants 1% defense bonus.
  • City fall resets durability to 0.
